item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 9, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. NeuralSVG: An Implicit Representation for Text-to-Vector Generation (546 points | 53 comments)
2. Ask HN: How can I learn to better command people's attention when speaking? (43 points | 37 comments)
3. Writing a simple pool allocator in C (112 points | 39 comments)
4. Cracking a 512-bit DKIM key for less than $8 in the cloud (678 points | 320 comments)

7. Operating System in 1,000 Lines – Intro (881 points | 93 comments)

11. The Latest Fake Literary Agencies (33 points | 6 comments)

14. Double-keyed caching: Browser cache partitioning (14 points | discuss)
15. New 16GB Raspberry Pi 5 on sale now at $120 (33 points | 15 comments)

19. Poka-Yoke (6 points | discuss)

24. Who would buy a Raspberry Pi for $120? (61 points | 78 comments)
25. My Experience Biohacking (15 points | 8 comments)
26. LA wildfires force thousands to evacuate, NASA JPL closed (299 points | 423 comments)
27. Steve Langasek, one of Ubuntu Linux's leading lights, has died (199 points | 11 comments)
28. Robotics 101 at UMich: Applied numerical linear algebra as intro linear algebra (216 points | 54 comments)
29. Luigi Mangione's account has been renamed on Stack Overflow (703 points | 522 comments)
30. Some programming language ideas (150 points | 132 comments)
